nodes.text: Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope (junior novelization)

Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope, also referred to as Star Wars Trilogy: A New Hope, is a Legends junior novel written by Ryder Windham, based  on a story and screenplay by George Lucas. It adapts the 1977 film Star Wars: Episode IV A New Hope, and it was first published on October 1, 2004 by Scholastic.

The novel was later collected in Star Wars Trilogy: Collector's Edition (2005), Star Wars Boxed Set: Episodes I–VI (2007), and Star Wars: Classic Trilogy (2014). A revised, canon edition of the novel, Star Wars: A New Hope, was published in 2014.
A long time ago in a galaxy far, far away....
A young Jedi is discovered. A rebellion grows. A deadly weapon unleashes its power. A master confronts his old apprentice. The journey begins a new chapter.
